node.title: Grandmother group among the victims at Waukeshaâ€™s Christmas parade.
node.alt: Police officers walk beside debris left from crowds in Waukesha on Sunday.
node.description: At least five people are dead after a driver plowed through a Christmas parade in a Milwaukee suburb on Sunday.
node.content: [" ", "Authorities have confirmed that at least five people are dead, and another 40 are injured.", "Among the victims are members of the Milwaukee Dancing Grannies. On Facebook on Monday, the group suggested that members had died. ", "\u201cThose who died were extremely passionate Grannies,\u201d the statement said. \u201cTheir eyes gleamed\u2026. joy of being a Grannie. They were the glue ... held us together.", "A representative of the group did not immediately return phone calls seeking more information, but the statement said the group would post more details as they became available. ", "\u201cThe Milwaukee Dancing Grannies are devastated by this terrible tragedy,\u201d the statement said, adding, \u201cOur group was doing what they loved, performing in front of crowds in a parade putting smiles on faces of all ages, filling them with joy and happiness.\u201d", "Officials with the Xtreme Dance team, another group that marched, asked for thoughts, prayers and \u201cprivacy to process the tragic events.\u201d ", "The Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Milwaukee said a priest, as well as parishioners and students at a local Catholic school, were among the injured.", ""]
